Greetings to Peruvian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Peruvian President 
   Pyongyang, July 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Peruvian President Alan Garcia Perez on the occasion of the independence day of Peru.
 Extending wholehearted congratulations to him on taking office as president, the message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop favorably.

Malaysian PM Wishes DPRK Success and Prosperity
articles.content:
Malaysian PM Wishes DPRK Success and Prosperity
   Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Malaysian Prime Minister Datuk Seri Abdullah Ahmad Badawi expressed hope that the DPRK would register success in its efforts for the reunification of the country and become a stable, prosperous and strong country.
 He said this when having a friendly conversation with the DPRK delegation headed by Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun at the parliamentary building on July 27. It was participating in the 13th Ministerial Meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum and paying an official visit to Malaysia.    
 The Malaysian prime minister sincerely thanked for the DPRK foreign minister's participation in the meeting, saying that it was greatly conducive to the progress in the work of the forum.

Greetings to King of Morocco
articles.content:
Greetings to King of Morocco
   Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Mohamed the Sixth, king of Morocco, on the occasion of its national day.
 The message wholeheartedly wished the king good health and happiness and the Moroccan people new progress and prosperity.

Visits
articles.content:
Visits
   Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korea-Russia Friendship Association led by Hong Son Ok, vice-chairperson of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairperson of the association, left here Saturday to visit Russia.
 It was seen off at Pyongyang Railway Station by officials concerned and the Russian charge d'affaires ad interim here.    
 A delegation of Japan-Korea Friendship led by Hiroyuki Kasai, dietman of the Saitama Prefectural Council for Japan-Korea Friendship and Solidarity, arrived here by air on Saturday.
